__e: If something happened between you that affects the job, I need to know.
Something that affects the restaurant, something that everyone sees, and there's no question.
Maybe, for the first time, I really understand that in a single moment, a person can make one wrong decision and it can affect the rest of their life.
Chloe, you are old enough now to realise that what you do affects other people.
'Cause we're all out here just trying our best, and when you say something nasty, that affects people.
Those were his last words. Well, I hate to side with your father, Peter, but you do kind of drink a lot. And you know, sometimes it affects the people you love.
Can't you see the effect this place is having on us all?
Look, I don't know what's going on with you lately, but everything you do affects us.

I debulked as much of his tumor as possible without affecting his speech.
So, this means something is affecting his brain.
